Commentary: starts with a wide length ball outside off, an inch or so inside the tramline. Left alone
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Tharanga, no run

Commentary: back of a length, angling in towards off stump and maybe straightening slightly. Defends after shuffling across, and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Tharanga, 1 run

Commentary: length ball slanting across into a fourth-stump line, defended towards cover point
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Samarawickrama, no run

Commentary: back of a length on middle and off, defended into the on side
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Samarawickrama, no run

Commentary: bowled him! He strikes in the first over yet again. No footwork from Sadeera against a length ball that comes in ever so slightly, towards middle and off, and he plays all around it. Maybe shaped to drive on the up at first, through mid-off or cover, and then ended up trying to adjust for the movement and play into the on side, but he only managed to leave a big gap, with his front leg going nowhere, and Usman says thank you very much
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Samarawickrama, OUT
Dismissal_text: S Samarawickrama  b Usman Shinwari 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: full outside off, and Usman Khan is on a hat-trick! An excellent ball to the new batsman, slanting it away from off stump, inviting the drive away from his body, and he went for it without getting his front foot across, and only manages to nick it to Sarfraz, who takes a low catch tumbling to his right
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Chandimal, OUT
Dismissal_text: LD Chandimal c †Sarfaraz Ahmed b Usman Shinwari 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: length ball slanting across towards off stump. Looks to drive into the covers, plays too early, and drags it to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Tharanga, no run

Commentary: length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone. A bit of extremely late swing towards Sarfraz's right just as the ball reaches him, and he does well to adjust for it
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Tharanga, no run

Commentary: length ball angling away from off stump, left alone
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Tharanga, no run

Commentary: length ball on middle stump, clipped to long leg
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Tharanga, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length, slanting across towards off stump, gets back and across to defend
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Thirimanne, no run

Commentary: back of a length, angling across towards off stump. Gets nicely behind it and blocks it back to the bowler. End of a good first over from Faheem.
Commentary_short: Faheem Ashraf to Thirimanne, no run

Commentary: and Tharanga leans into a sweetly timed drive. Fullisj outside off, nice front-foot stride ensures he gets close to the pitch of the ball, and he frees his arms and strokes it through cover point
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Tharanga, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball angling into off stump, tucked away, with the angle, through backward square leg
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Tharanga, 2 runs

Commentary: bowled him, how good is this man! That skiddy, slippery pace, and it nips in from outside off stump, from the perfect length, and it's through the gate before Tharanga knows it. He was stuck on the crease, looking to whip that through midwicket, and next thing he knew was the sound of the stumps rattled. Great seam position - he's generating this movement because of how much backspin he puts on it.
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Tharanga, OUT
Dismissal_text: WU Tharanga  b Usman Shinwari 8 (9b 1x4 0x6) SR: 88.88

Commentary: back of a length outside off, dabbed to backward point
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Dickwella, no run

Commentary: big appeal, and it's given! Goes wide of the crease and angles it into the stumps, and Dickwella's head falls over as he plays all across it. He's reviewed, though... That dramatic angle in, plus a bit of inward movement - will this hit the stumps? No inside edge. Impact in line with middle stump, and ball-tracking says it's clipping the outside of leg stump, umpire's call, so Dickwella has to walk back. Four wickets in 11 balls for Usman Khan Shinwari. Remember the name, and all that
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Dickwella, OUT
Dismissal_text: N Dickwella lbw b Usman Shinwari 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: length ball fairly wide of off, left alone

Commentary: length ball slanting away in the corridor, nips away slightly off the seam and beats Thirimanne's uncertain push

Commentary: back of a length angling down leg, looks to flick it away but it zips through and hits his hip and Sarfraz, moving to his right, can't collect cleanly and concedes a leg-bye

Commentary: back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Doesn't get back and across to defend, just jabs with his hands, and the ball hits the inside half of his bat and rolls into the leg side

Commentary: fullish on off stump, driven back towards the bowler

Commentary: fuller now, not quite a half-volley, but the angle provides him some width, and he takes a short step forward and plays an all-hands drive, with an open face, through point. Excellent timing

Commentary: back of a length, pitching outside leg. Looks to flick but can't connect, and it hits his front pad

Commentary: ooh. Length ball angling in towards off stump. He's a little late coming onto the front foot. Wants to drive into the covers, plays away from his body, and inside-edges past his leg stump

Commentary: back of a length, angling into off and middle. Shuffles across to clip watchfully to midwicket

Commentary: length ball, fifth-stump line. Doesn't quite time his drive, rolls slowly to extra-cover

Commentary: shortish outside off, the inward angle narrows his room a little, and he chops it down to cover point

Commentary: full, a bit of width, and what a way to get your fifth wicket. The softest dismissal for Siriwardana, just reaches away from his body to drive, plays a touch too early, and scoops a simple catch to cover point. This is only Usman's fourth over!
Commentary_short: Usman Shinwari to Siriwardana, OUT
Dismissal_text: TAM Siriwardana c Fakhar Zaman b Usman Shinwari 6 (13b 1x4 0x6) SR: 46.15

Commentary: back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and guides it down towards third man, who has some distance to cover to his right, and they steal a second. Still has to dive to complete the second, and he's just in. Or is he? He's diving in, his bat is past the crease, it's only a quarter-inch from the ground, but is it touching the ground when the bails go off? The third umpire thinks so

Commentary: a slower delivery outside off, tapped away towards backward point for a quick single. But Prasanna is in a terrible position, he looks to evade the ball that's coming at him but doesn't bother about grounding his bat. The fielder throws the stumps down directly at the batsman's end, and he's gone. At point of impact, bat and stumps, Prasanna has turned his head away, looking at midwicket for the left-hander. If he kept his focus on grounding his bat, and not the ball hurtling towards him, he would have made it easily. The bat is in the air and SL are seven down.
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Perera, OUT
Dismissal_text: S Prasanna run out (Shadab Khan) 16 (34b 0x4 1x6) SR: 47.05

Commentary: all done! Dusted! SL bowled out for 103. Shortish delivery outside off, Chameera goes back, tries to flick the ball into the leg side, the ball takes the inside edge and knocks into the stumps to end the innings.
Commentary_short: Hasan Ali to Chameera, OUT
Dismissal_text: PVD Chameera  b Hasan Ali 11 (15b 1x4 0x6) SR: 73.33

Commentary: fullish on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: length ball, a bit of swing in towards middle stump, tucked away to long leg - played around his front pad a little on that occasion, but leaned over the ball and played it under his eyes
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: length ball on off stump, and he uses Chameera's angle to make himself some room and punch through cover point
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, 2 runs

Commentary: length ball angling away from off stump, the angle provides Zaman some width, and that's a monstrous flat-bat slap that goes to the cover point boundary in a flash
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball angling into off stump, defended towards mid-on
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: good ball, some swing away from the left-hander from a good length outside off. Goes for the cover drive and the ball beats his outside edge
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: similar ball to the previous one - this time Imam leaves it alone
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: length ball, a bit closer to off stump. Presses forward, opens his bat face, and dabs to backward point
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, again Imam's outside edge is beaten by some swing as he looks to stand still and punch through the covers
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: and again. Not a big enough stride to get close to the pitch of the ball, looks for the angled-bat drive, and the ball curves past his outside edge again
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: wow. He's beaten him for the fourth time in the over. This is back of a length, angling in and forcing him to play, and then snaking away late. Looks to defend off the back foot and the ball slides past that outside edge again
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: full outside off, driven back firmly to the bowler
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: drifts on the pads does Chameera, off the pad towards square leg. Zaman looking to hit the ball too hard
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, 1 leg bye

Commentary: full around off, the ball coming back in, defended back to the bowler with the full face of the bat
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: full around off, very tidy lines, defended towards mid-on
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: full delivery outsider off, 87 mph, hit into the off side with bad timing
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: good single. Good length around off, driven towards mid-on with soft hands for a quick single.
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, punched to backward point
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: back of a length, this time Fernando gets the ball to nip back in off the seam. Looks to adjust late and work into the on side but all he can manage is an inside-edge into pad
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: he's had enough of Fernando making him push and prod, and he jumps down the track, gets some width, and smacks it up and over the covers
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, FOUR runs

Commentary: big appeal for lbw as Imam plays around that front pad again. The ball seemed to be sliding down leg - maybe an inside edge too, because umpire S Ravi doesn't signal leg byes
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, 2 runs

Commentary: back of a length, angling into off stump, defended to extra-cover
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: shortish on off stump, punched to backward point
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: fullish, angling into off stump, driven into the covers
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: fullish, angling down leg. Looks to whip it into the on side and is beaten by the angle and hit on the front pad.
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: back of a length, angling down leg. Misses the flick and gets a bit of pad on it down to fine leg
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, 1 leg bye

Commentary: back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Lets it come to him and plays with soft hands towards square leg
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: full outside off, drives down the ground, to the left of mid-off, and calls for a single, but Fakhar sends him back, and rightly, because the fielder moved quickly to cut the ball off
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: back of a length, angling into off stump, lets it come on and clips to midwicket
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: length ball outside off, Fakhar goes for a flat-bat slash and misses
Commentary_short: Fernando to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: full now, and that's put away nicely. Leans forward and lets his hands flow through a drive to the right of mid-off
Commentary_short: Fernando to Fakhar Zaman, FOUR runs

Commentary: full again, a bit wider, driven to cover point
Commentary_short: Fernando to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: length ball on off stump, pushed towards mid-off, where Thisara misfields to allow a single
Commentary_short: Fernando to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: length ball outside off, and now Imam's feet seem to be moving better. Gets a good stride forward and across to block into the covers
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: full now, on middle stump, and that's beautifully played by Imam. Doesn't get his front pad in the way, which means he can bring his bat down nice and straight and show the full face to drive down the ground, to the right of mid-on
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, FOUR runs

Commentary: back of a length, angling into off stump. Stays leg-side of the ball, looking to punch through the off side, but the inward angle forces him to play it back towards the bowler, off the inner half of his bat
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: length ball on off stump, punched to mid-on. They chance a single even though it didn't go too far from the fielder, and a direct hit at the bowler's end would have had the diving Fakhar in a lot of trouble. Thirimanne, however, misses the stumps
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: length ball on middle and off, blocked back down the pitch
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: bouncer angling down leg. Swivels to hook, doesn't middle it, and it rolls away slowly into the long leg region
Commentary_short: Chameera to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length, angling into leg stump, whipped away through square leg
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, 2 runs

Commentary: length ball angling into off stump, clears his front leg and swipes across the line, only manages to drag it to long leg off the inside half of his bat
Commentary_short: Chameera to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, punched to cover point
Commentary_short: Fernando to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: back of a length on off and middle, tucked away through square leg
Commentary_short: Fernando to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: down the track and Imam has a big swing at this length ball outside off, looking to smack it over mid-off. Doesn't get close enough to the pitch to do that, and he misses completely
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: bouncer outside off, left alone
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: shortish on off stump, pulled away through midwicket, doesn't really time it
Commentary_short: Fernando to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: wide-ish half-volley, and that's lovely from Fakhar, drives with a slightly open face, and it rockets away to the cover point boundary
Commentary_short: Fernando to Fakhar Zaman, FOUR runs

Commentary: tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: floated up high and slow, ends up as a yorker on middle and off, blocked back down the pitch
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: shortish, slides on with the angle to provide some width, and Fakhar stabs to backward point
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: back of a length, close to off stump, and that's lovely. That was pushed through quite quick, and he uses the pace, opens his bat face and guides it away into the big gap to the right of backward point
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, FOUR runs

Commentary: that's a poor shot. Much fuller this time, and it turns a bit so it's not far outside off stump at all. Goes back for that back-cut again and the ball beats his outside edge
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: length ball close to off stump, stabbed into the point region
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: shortish on off stump. A bit of extra bounce and no room for that late dab to third man. The ball hits his glove and rolls towards backward point
Commentary_short: Perera to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length on off stump, punched towards mid-on
Commentary_short: Perera to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to dab to third man
Commentary_short: Perera to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: slower ball on off stump, defended to midwicket
Commentary_short: Perera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: down the track now, Perera shortens his length, so it gets up to about waist-height, but Imam doesn't care. Just opens up at the hips and hits a horizontal-bat swat straight back over the bowler's head. Wow.
Commentary_short: Perera to Imam-ul-Haq, SIX runs

Commentary: well played again. The bouncer to follow up and he keeps his eye on it and sways his upper body away from the line
Commentary_short: Perera to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: floated up full on leg and middle, jabbed back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on to bring up Pakistan's 50
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: flighty full-toss outside off, driven to extra-cover
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: tossed up outside off, driven to the right of mid-off
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: tossed up on middle and leg, driven to long-on
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: better length now, turns from middle towards leg, gets on the front foot and clips to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: fullish  on the pads, a terrible ball to bowl with fine leg inside the circle, and he flicks it away to the left of that fielder
Commentary_short: Perera to Fakhar Zaman, FOUR runs

Commentary: slower offcutter, back of a length on off stump. Lets it come on and dabs to third man
Commentary_short: Perera to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: short ball, short, on off stump, pulled through midwicket
Commentary_short: Perera to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length on off stump, punched to extra-cover
Commentary_short: Perera to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: short ball, only gets up to about stomach-height, at no great pace, and he swivels round to pull that to the backward square leg boundary
Commentary_short: Perera to Fakhar Zaman, FOUR runs

Commentary: slower length ball on middle and off, stays leg-side of the ball, lets it come to him, and stabs to backward point
Commentary_short: Perera to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: legbreak turning down leg, clipped to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: tossed up outside off, stretches out for a gentle push to the right of extra-cover
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: tossed up and overpitched on off stump, and he steps away from the line to make a bit of room and drives crisply through the covers
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, FOUR runs

Commentary: overpitched again, wider outside off, flat-batted to the right of sweeper cover
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: full on middle and off, whipped hard, back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: length ball, looked like the googly pitching on middle and straightening. Defended into the on side
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: back of a length on middle and leg, goes deep in his crease to work it to deep square leg
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: on the pads now, clipped to deep backward square leg
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: stays back to a quickish length ball slanting across to off stump, defends it back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: tossed up on off stump, and he goes for the open-hipped sweep, ends up bottom-edging between his legs and past leg stump
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Fakhar Zaman, 2 runs

Commentary: back of a length googly turning from just outside leg. Worked away through midwicket
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: tossed up and he skips out to clip it with the turn to long-on
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: loop and dip outside off. Looks to stretch out and work it with the turn but doesn't get the pitch and is hit on the pad
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: flatter, goes back to clip towards square leg
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: tossed up on off stump, defended into the on side
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: flat and full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: full and flighted on off stump. Looks to whip to long-on but the bowler dives and gets in the way
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: tossed up outside off, plays a drive with a lot of bottom wrist on it, to sweeper cover
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: worked away off the pads towards deep backward square leg
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: shortish around middle and leg, punched towards midwicket
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: quick on the pads, nudged away towards deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: strays down leg, Imam misses a flick, Dickwella doesn't collect cleanly either, three wides
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, 3 wides

Commentary: slow around leg, clipped to midwicket. Good diving stop from the fielder
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: a low full toss down leg, swept away towards deep backward square leg
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: the googly, flummoxes Zaman, who gets a thick outside edge towards point
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: shortish down leg, punched away towards long-on
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run

Commentary: Imam comes down and chips a drive to long-on for one more
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: ooh, a wild swing, flat outside off, Zaman inside-edges his slog into his body
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, no run

Commentary: and gone! No? No, says umpire Raza. Dickwella is absolutely sure so Sri Lanka review. I think he has edged that. A googly outside off, generates so much extra bounce, Zaman picks it and looks to dab a cut down to third man but all he can do is feather that through to the keeper. A big spike on UltraEdge as the ball takes the edge. Fine catch from Dickwella, he too picked the googly and got his hands in the right position
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Fakhar Zaman, OUT
Dismissal_text: Fakhar Zaman c †Dickwella b Vandersay 48 (47b 7x4 0x6) SR: 102.12

Commentary: strays down leg, wide
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Faheem Ashraf, 1 wide

Commentary: another googly outside off, 82 kph, pushed back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Faheem Ashraf, no run

Commentary: short and wide, filth, stays low, Ashraf misses a cut. That over just delayed this game a few minutes. All overs hereon will
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Faheem Ashraf, no run

Commentary: 81 kph, strays down leg, worked down to fine leg
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: runs down to the pitch, gets there and drives the ball to long-on for one
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: strays down leg again, another wide
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Faheem Ashraf, 1 wide

Commentary: flight around off, Ashraf gets forward, a thick inside edge towards square leg for one
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run

Commentary: drifts on the pads again, worked to midwicket
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: another nudge towards midwicket, tight run. Chandimal picks up and returns the throw to the batsman's end, but he has made it with time and matres to spare
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: flight outside off, pushed through outside off, defended back
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Faheem Ashraf, no run

Commentary: short and wide outside off, 54 mph, Imam races back and nails a late, late cut that goes past short third man's right
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, FOUR runs

Commentary: short and wide outside off, carved to the sweeper cover
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: goes after it, lots of flight outside off, Faheem wants to go straight, the ball skews off the inside half towards long-on
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run

Commentary: overpitched on off, jammed back
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

Commentary: quick outside off, shovelled away towards long-on for one more
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: too full outside off, jammed out
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Faheem Ashraf, no run

Commentary: shortish down leg, worked away through to deep square leg for one
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: well bowled, flat outside off, the ball slides through to beat the bat. Pushed that through in the air
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Faheem Ashraf, no run

Commentary: another googly outside off, defended towards cover for one. Nice soft hands, good response
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run

Commentary: another googly around off, Imam hurries back, picks the length and the variation and works the ball to square leg
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

Commentary: shortish around off, clipped to midwicket
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Faheem Ashraf, no run

Commentary: a shovelled heave to deep midwicket. Flight outside off, Ashraf wants to finish the game with a six over midwicket, but the ball trickles away off the inside half
Commentary_short: Prasanna to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run

Commentary: 82 kph, flight on leg, pushed to long-off
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run

Commentary: there is the match and the series. Short and wide outside off, carved past point, past short third man for four. Pakistan sweep Sri Lanka 5-0 in the rout-iest rout of all possible routs.
Commentary_short: Vandersay to Imam-ul-Haq, FOUR runs
